scenario_text.value: Hey, Ryo, what are you up to?
Hey, Takuma. Nothing really.
Kew...

(Hmm, I’m still curious. Then again, with the
fight coming up, maybe I should let him be.)
(What should I tell Ryo?)
Didn’t look that way.
If you say so...
Didn’t look that way.

Really? Because it sure looked like you were
doing something to me.

Man, why do you always have to be so nosy?
When did you turn into my old man?

You don’t have to say if you don’t want to,
but if something’s bothering you, I’m here.

*sigh*... Right, sorry. But really, it’s
nothing.
If you say so...
All right, if you say so.
Well I do, so get lost!

I’ll just stay here with Kunemon a bit
longer.
Kew...

...Now I have to know. Why do you look so
down?

What? I don’t even know what you’re talking
about!
I was just...

I wanted to spend some time alone with
Kunemon, okay? That’s all.
Kew...
Time alone with Kunemon?

You heard me. After all, if we lose this
final battle, we die.

And if we win, we go back to our world.
Either way, it’s goodbye.

So I just...want to spend as much time
together as we can.
Kew, kew...
(Ryo seems kind of embarrassed.)
What? You got a problem with that?

(Really, I’m surprised at how far Ryo has
come. He’s nothing like how he used to be.)

(But if I say that, it might embarrass him
again. Maybe I should try to be more subtle.)
(Umm, what should I say to him?)
I think it’s good.
I’m just surprised.
I think it’s good.
No, I think it’s good.

To be honest, I’m sad about having to say
goodbye to Agumon too.
Hmph.

We all owe these guys a lot. Anyone’d get
choked up about leaving them behind.
I’m just surprised.

I’m just surprised. It’s not really a bad
thing, but it’s a huge change from before.

Oh, shut up! Just leave me alone, okay?! Get
lost!
Kewww! Kewkew!!!
Kew? Kew, kewkew.
Yeah, you’re right.

I owe you so much, and I treated you pretty
badly.

Do you think... Kunemon, have I been a good
partner to you?
Kew.

(That sounded very kind. I’m sure Kunemon
said yes.)

(Of course, it’s not like I actually know
that. Ryo is really the expert on Kunemon.)
(What’s Kunemon saying?)
A yes, I think?
I don’t really know.
...that’s a yes.

That’s a yes. Kunemon clearly thinks you’ve
been a good partner.

Oh, give it a rest! You’ve got no idea what
Kunemon’s saying. Don’t make stuff up.
Kewkew!
Hmph.

You mean that? Thanks, Kunemon. I feel the
same way about you.
You’re the best partner I could ever have.
...what did he say?

So, what did that mean just now? What did
Kunemon say?

Oh, who knows? Kew just means kew. It’s not
like I speak the language.
Really?
Yes, really! Now go on, get lost!
Kew...
Hmph.
Thanks, Kunemon.
Kew!

I’m ready to head out any time. What’s taking
you so long?
